reviews.review_msg: Very very nice prof but a useless class. Talk in class, parcitipation wroth 20% ! Very energetic to teach us calculations not needed for the final. Always smile when listening to others' presentations, even if it sucks, or when the time he told us his house got broken into.

Well, for me this was a nightmare of a class.  Her notes were practically useless, and her methods were very different from the book.  The amount of content was also ridiculous.  I'm just glad I got out in one piece.  I can't speak for anyone else, but I would avoid taking this class with her.

Very enthusiatic about her material, and is very nice to students. Her exams are tough, but fair. As long as u can committ yourself to doing (and completely understanding) all the assignments and sample exams, you'll be fine. Her notes are unclear at times, so you can't get by without reading the text. Overall, one of the better accounting profs.
Excellent accounting professor!  She made consolidation seem almost easy!  Her final is a bit tough, but if you do all of the assignments, you should have no problems aceing it!

Is always very hyper. Sometimes I'm not sure she knows what she is talking about. Got an A in the class but mostly from self study, it was often difficult to understand the lectures. Her enthusiasm is great and she is a terrific person.
One of the best profs ever.  Funny & engaging; definitely take a class with her.

Kim is a very nice prof, just not the best for teaching Consolidation..  It's a tough course and she gets confused a lot while teaching, which confuses the entire class. Be ready to teach yourself material.  Attend all classes though, she does provide format which helps a lot. Homework checkattendance every class.   TL;DR: Nice but confusing
Intelligent, fair, helpful, and interesting. Stephen is simply one of the best profs in the business faculty!
She is a good and caring professor. Attend the lectures, do the hw questions. Her slides are good to study for the exams. No surprises in the exams.
Do the practice questions she assigns in class then you will do well on her exams

Arsineh did a really good job of teaching the course online for the first time. I studied what she recommended maybe only a week before the midterm/final and ended up doing fine by making detailed excel templates and notes for each chapter. Do the assigned hw, study what she tells you, and rewatch her lectures for clarification, and you'll be fine!

All genuine. Arsineh is not the best at teaching online, but this is a difficult time for both students and profs. However, this is how I succeeded in this course: REIVEW ALL NOTES, REVIEW TEXTBOOK SECTIONS SHE MENTIONS ONLY, AND DO ALL ASSIGNED PROBLEMS. I did not pre read nor did I do extra practice problems. Open book + recorded lectures also?!

She is a very kind professor. I think midterm is much harder than final exam, final exam do not need to do the excel. I got a low mark on midterm below average, but final exam do better, get b+. Reading textbook is very useful before lecture, but there are too many materials in textbook.

This is a great course, you don't become a CFO, but you understand accounting and finances, I'm not sure about the bad reviews, most likely people who did not want to do the work , She's awesome and will attend her classes again.
prof is understanding and wants students to do well, course is difficult by nature but she tries her best to help you excel

When I first enrolled in this course, I was very worried about it being online. Needless to say, because Arsineh cares a lot about her students doing well, she made it a smooth and easy transition to online learning. She gives BOTH midterm and final review tips so study those concepts and you will do well. Recommend taking it with her online.

She's very nice. She cares so much about her students and wants everyone to do well in the class. She would give us tips how to study for the exam and pinpoint important material to be learned. The course itself is hard, so you need extra effort to truly understand the material. However, she is accessible outside class if you have any questions.

This prof doesnt teach well. You have to learn everything from textbook and chapter problems yourself. No guideline given on how to solve her questions. The multiple choices on midterm are non sense. Midterm 35% final 55% quizzes 10% . Avoid her if you can. Her slides really just duplicated from the publisher slides. Nothing insightful taught.

I am taking 420 online with her. Gosh I do not know how she gets such a good rating here. She does NOT teach anything! Not even a little bit! You really have to teach yourself everything with textbook. And do not trust her words on what would be on exams as she gives questions she said "won't be on exam". She is nice but does not teach well.

Honestly, good luck if ur in her class, and the class is online. U can ask her a question and she will straight up ignore you or tell you how others in the class get the information and you don't. Ive never met a prof who is so rude and unhelpful.

I'm taking BUS420 with her online right now and it's so chaotic. Be prepared to teach yourself the material with ZERO help from her. I asked her for help on an assignment and she literally said "no". I have no idea why her rating is so high.

Arsineh is a nice, east-going, funny prof. She's probably one of the most understanding and helpful profs in terms of asking for additional help. Her exams are clear cut and relevant to the homework examples. Only thing is she goes through examples in class too quickly many times. Overall, I would recommend her

This class is hard but having a nice and caring prof makes it so much easier. You have to accept the fact that this is tough course but this professor makes it bearable. She genuinely cares about helping students. She understands the struggles the students have. Easily the most caring prof at SFU.

Highly recommend you take BUS 420 with her. She is probably one of the easiest professors and she is super friendly as well. As long as you study you are guaranteed to do well. Average grade is usually an A-.

I took both 254 and 420 with her. She is my best accounting prof ever! She understands for student's situation and tries her best to facilitate them. She gave students very detailed guideline to study for exams. No need to read the book, only need it to do practices which are critical to preparing for the tests. Never think 420 can be this easy :)

As a fourth year accounting student, I've come across various professors. Arsineh is definitely in my top 3. She's insanely kind and makes it very clear for what is to be expected on the exams. She really feels for students and their struggles, so she likes to make it a smooth semester for them. Professors like her are very rare.

What a prof!!! Good sense of humor. She is trying to make everything more simple for students to understand and emphasize things that need more focus in the exam. She is very clear about her expectations and how everything is marked.  Chose her class and for a first time I felt like accounting is understandable :)

A good prof, and a great person. Took 254 and 420 with her, and she is like a friend who truly cares about you. She provides good assignment questions and templates, so that questions on exams are not a surprise. Don't come and expect to learn everything in class though, as the course material is very heavy.

I've never wrote a review for my prof here. But this time I feel I have to. She's very friendly and kind to students. You'd know what to expect in exams as long as u go to lectures. BUT she goes through things WAY TOO FAST! U get lost easily&wouldn't understand a single thing if u come to class w/o reading ahead. Tbh, I'm better off reading myself
Extremely fair professor which makes it very clear what is going to be on exams. If you understand the assignments, the exams are easy. Best prof to take this challenging class with.
Awesome professor. Super nice. Her slides are very clear informative. She will go through most of the questions covered in the exams during the class. Highly recommend.

Really easy going prof, sometimes skip off stuff on slide, but made every key point clear. In my class there were too many straight A students so she gave no F or D ! & love those Easter eggs and cookies

You should be prepared to work hard. She will make you do many assignments as well as solve problems in class. As well, she walks around the class to check your work. The class is not a walkover! If you attend class and put in the hard work, you will do well on the exams.

Very funny and nice. One of the most caring instructors I've had! Gives enough in-class practice to ensure you know how to solve the problems. Exams are pretty easy as well because she tells you what to study for.
Don't take Bus 420 with her. Unable to make concepts understandable...
A prof who actually cares about her students. The material itself can be hard but she tells you exactly what to expect on the exams.
Really helpful and nice. The material is difficult, but she goes out of her way to make sure everyone understands.
Jamal is very clear teaching 420 and makes a "hard" class very easy by the way he explains things. If you keep up with homework and practice questions, you can definitely do well in this class.
He ok.

Jamal is the best professor I have ever had! The course is known to be difficult. However, Jamal provides clear notes and explains the concepts extremely well. He is also always available to provide extra help. Only lazy students do not do well in this course. If you do your homework and study, you will succeed. Jamal is amazing!

Anne MacDonald is the reason why it's worth taking accounting at SFU.  When you are doing your CA, CGA, or CMA program and you find your technical is strong and you know the Handbook well, when others are struggling, you can thank Anne.

Absolutely awesome! One of my favarite profs at SFU. I've taken 3 acct. curses with her (rite, all the courses she tought, BUS251, 319, 420). Her lecture helped you a lot to understand the material. A lot easier when you read textbook after classes. This course is not that hard if you like numbers. BTW, the textbook is really clear and easy to read
Excellent professor. The course itself is loaded with info. Midterm is easy,final is a bit tough.  No surprises in exams.
Tough course, marterial is super HARD. But the exam is reasonable. Must spend a lot of time to study for midterm and final and you will get an A, like me. LOL
